etymology.description: 痧 (rash) + 子 (noun suffix) = rash illness; measles.
etymology.interpretation: Colloquial/regional name for a rash illness, often equivalent to measles (麻疹). Emphasizes the rash aspect signaled by 痧.

examples.chinese: 孩子出痧子了(孩子出痧子了)，别着凉(別著涼)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi chū shāzi le, bié zháo liáng.
examples.english: The child has come out with measles; don’t let them catch cold.

examples.chinese: 医生说他得了痧子(醫生說他得了痧子)，需要休息(需要休息)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng shuō tā dé le shāzi, xūyào xiūxi.
examples.english: The doctor said he has measles and needs rest.

examples.chinese: 出痧子时要注意隔离(出痧子時要注意隔離)，防止传染(防止傳染)。
examples.pinyin: Chū shāzi shí yào zhùyì gélí, fángzhǐ chuánrǎn.
examples.english: When measles breaks out, isolation is important to prevent transmission.
